projects.title: SpellBound Survival
projects.blurb: A 3D survival game, built for mobile using Unity and C#. Players gather resources, craft, and battle enemies in a dynamic world.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: SpellBound Survival is a 3D magic-themed survival game developed in Unity3D using C#. Built primarily for Android with adaptive resolution and touch controls, it challenges players to explore, gather materials, craft tools, and survive in a procedurally generated world filled with enemies and elemental hazards.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Scene & State Management: Seamless transitions between menus, zones, and gameplay scenes with persistent player data.
Zone & Difficulty Design: Procedurally populated biomes with multiple difficulty levels and visual indicators on the world map.
Loot & Combat System: Unique enemy stats, behaviors, and loot tables. Real-time combat and spellcasting using a shared mana pool.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Custom Building & Storage System: Modular base-building with snapping placement and persistent save data.
Dynamic Interaction Framework: Unified input for gathering, combat, and interaction via contextual touch-based controls.
Editor Customization: Designer-friendly tools for creating and balancing items, enemies, and loot tables.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Touch-optimized mobile controls
Procedural zone generation
Persistent inventory and progression
Custom base building system
Adaptive resolution support
Real-time spellcasting combat

projects.title: Fortune Slots
projects.blurb: A polished collection of themed slot-machine games for mobile, featuring custom payouts, bonus rounds, and daily rewards.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Fortune Slots is a mobile slot-machine collection built in Unity3D using C#. Designed for Android and iOS, it features multiple themed machines, adaptive UI layouts, and daily reward systems that keep players engaged. Each machine supports custom paylines, bet options, and dynamic bonus rounds.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Scene Management: Smooth transitions between menus, machines, and bonus modes with persistent data.
Selection Hub: Scrollable machine selector with unlockable content and preview animations.
Wheel of Fortune: Daily reward wheel system offering free spins or currency bonuses.
Bonus Mechanics: Configurable special rounds that trigger on symbol matches or random intervals.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Fully data-driven slot templates configurable in the Unity editor.
Dynamic payout tables and adjustable bet modifiers per machine type.
Optimized for both portrait and landscape modes across multiple devices.
Cross-platform ready — deployable to Windows builds with minimal changes.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Multiple themed slot machines
Daily Wheel of Fortune rewards
Bonus rounds and mini-games
Custom paylines and bet systems
Touch-optimized UI
Persistent player progress

projects.title: Shape Wars
projects.blurb: A fast-paced 2D arcade shooter for Android featuring enemy waves, boss encounters, and adaptive difficulty scaling.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Shape Wars is a 2D side-scrolling shooter developed in Unity3D using C#. Designed for Android, it delivers classic arcade action with modern touches such as touch-based movement, adaptive resolution, and progressive difficulty scaling across multiple enemy types and bosses.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Dynamic Level Progression with wave-based difficulty scaling and boss fights.
High Score Persistence: Session data is saved and compared using Unity’s PlayerPrefs system.
Enemy AI Framework: Each enemy features unique movement and attack behaviors.
Custom UI and control system for intuitive mobile play.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Data-driven wave definitions and enemy configurations.
Modular architecture for easily adding new enemy or boss types.
Adaptive resolution rendering pipeline for consistent visuals.
Cross-platform-ready design supporting PC builds without modification.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Fast-paced 2D combat
Procedural enemy waves
Persistent high scores
Touch-based controls
Dynamic difficulty
Replayable arcade gameplay

projects.title: Blackjack
projects.blurb: A C++ implementation of the classic casino card game, built from scratch using SDL2 with a modular, state-driven architecture.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Blackjack is a digital recreation of the classic casino game, developed for Windows using C++ and the SDL2 library suite. The project focuses on object-oriented design, clean architecture, and responsive UI systems to simulate an authentic card game experience.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: State Machine System: Handles transitions between menus, gameplay, and pause states cleanly and modularly.
Dealer Logic: Implements authentic rule-based behavior for card drawing and outcome resolution.
Timed Animations: Manages card dealing and pacing for smooth, realistic presentation.
Mouse-Driven UI: Intuitive input system with hover states, animations, and contextual buttons.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: C++ and SDL2-based rendering and input system.
Implements State and Strategy patterns for scalable, maintainable design.
Efficient memory management and lightweight game loop.
Cross-platform potential with minimal dependency adjustments.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Classic Blackjack gameplay
State-driven architecture
Dealer AI logic
Card animations
Mouse-based input
Lightweight SDL2 framework

projects.title: Battle for Earth
projects.blurb: A 2D platformer built in C++ with Allegro4, featuring custom physics, enemy AI, and modular text-driven level design.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Battle for Earth is a 2D side-scrolling platformer developed entirely in C++ using the Allegro4 library. It features hand-built physics, modular state management, and text-driven level design. Players navigate custom levels, engage enemies, and experience a short narrative journey.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Custom Physics Engine: Implements gravity, collision detection, and platform movement logic.
State Management: Modular control over menu, gameplay, and pause states.
Text-Based Level Design: Levels and objects are defined using easily editable text files.
Dual Input Support: Playable via both keyboard and mouse controls.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Allegro4-based rendering and input handling in C++.
Text-driven content creation pipeline for rapid level design.
Configurable enemy and block behavior via external data.
Efficient architecture supporting extensible new content.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Custom physics and collisions
Editable text-based levels
Unique enemy AI behaviors
Dual input support
State-driven game structure

projects.title: Space Fighter
projects.blurb: A modern remake of the classic Asteroids arcade game, built in C++ using Allegro5 with dynamic scaling, power-ups, and parallax effects.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Space Fighter is a modern re-imagining of the classic Asteroids arcade experience, written in C++ with the Allegro5 framework. It showcases modular state management, parallax backgrounds, and progressive difficulty scaling while maintaining responsive, physics-based controls.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: State-Machine Architecture for menus, gameplay, and pause screens.
Dynamic Difficulty Scaling to increase enemy waves over time.
Randomized Power-Up System granting temporary weapon upgrades.
Parallax Background layers for visual depth and motion.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: C++ Allegro5-based rendering and timing systems.
Unified rendering pipeline shared between UI and gameplay.
Real-time spawning and physics simulation.
Lightweight architecture optimized for smooth 2D performance.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Classic Asteroids-style gameplay
Dynamic enemy waves
Collectible power-ups
Smooth parallax scrolling
Progressive scoring system
Optimized for Windows

projects.title: Lab Sim
projects.blurb: A 3D interactive laboratory simulator built in Unity and C#, developed for educational training in realistic scientific environments.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Lab Sim is a professional 3D virtual laboratory built in Unity using C#. It provides realistic, physics-based interactions for academic training, allowing students to perform complex experiments safely in an immersive environment.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Physics-based interaction and fluid dynamics.
Chemical reaction visualization and logic.
Interactive scientific tools (microscopes, scales, containers).
Time simulation system for long-term experiments.
Modular protocol framework for multiple experiment types.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Unity C# systems with real-time physics and shader effects.
Configurable modules for rapid content expansion.
Scenario-based design driven by external data.
Custom UI and input architecture optimized for training efficiency.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Accurate scientific simulation
Fluid and solid dynamics
Multiple experiment modes
Time acceleration system
Modular design
Academic collaboration

projects.title: Saving Security
projects.blurb: A branching-narrative 3D simulation where player choices dynamically affect storylines, factions, and world outcomes.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Saving Security is a 3D narrative simulation game built in Unity and C#. Every player decision influences relationships, events, and endings across a branching storyline framework designed for replayability and emotional impact.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Data-driven narrative system using ScriptableObjects.
Choice and consequence framework affecting factions and story paths.
Faction reputation tracking influencing dialogue and access.
Dynamic scene loading and persistent world state.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Branching storylines
Reactive faction AI
Replayable structure
Player-driven outcomes
Narrative summary screens

projects.title: Catch Up
projects.blurb: A turn-based logic card game featuring modular AI opponents and scalable gameplay systems.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Catch Up is a numerical strategy card game built in Unity and C#, showcasing AI-driven opponents, data-driven configuration, and modular turn-based logic systems.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Turn-based round controller with real-time score tracking.
AI behavior trees supporting multiple difficulty profiles.
Configurable deck and rule definitions for client variants.
Statistics tracking and session summary features.

projects.title: Rescue Squad
projects.blurb: A Unity-based mission simulator testing player decision-making and risk management through adaptive scenarios.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Rescue Squad is a mission-based simulation game built in Unity to analyze player decision-making, risk assessment, and adaptive strategy. Players manage a team of adventurers to complete dynamically generated missions with varying success probabilities.

projects.title: Bargaining Sim
projects.blurb: A negotiation-training simulator featuring AI-driven bargaining logic and performance evaluation.

projects.title: Security Controls
projects.blurb: An educational cybersecurity-themed card game that reinforces learning through repetition and active recall.

projects.title: Consumer Cognition
projects.blurb: A Unity-based educational city-builder where players earn currency by answering quiz questions to construct and upgrade their city.

projects.title: Game Theory
projects.blurb: An interactive WebGL simulation that teaches foundational concepts of game theory using adjustable decision-based scenarios.

projects.title: Marketing Sim
projects.blurb: A browser-based marketing strategy simulator that teaches campaign budgeting and outcome analysis through interactive scenarios.
